top_procedures.description: Percutaneous transcatheter placement of drug eluting intracoronary stent(s), with coronary angioplasty when performed; single major coronary artery or branch
Insertion or replacement of single or dual chamber pacing defibrillator leads
Insertion of new or replacement of permanent pacemaker including upper and lower chamber electrodes
Removal and replacement of dual lead permanent pacemaker pulse generator
Insertion of catheter for imaging of heart blood vessels or grafts
Removal and replacement of defibrillator pulse generator
Insertion of needle and/or catheter into dialysis circuit and balloon dilation of dialysis segment, with imaging including radiological supervision and interpretation
Insertion of catheter in left heart for imaging of blood vessels or grafts and left lower heart

Excision of blood clot and/or infusion to dissolve blood clot in dialysis circuit and balloon dilation of dialysis segment, , accessed through the skin, with imaging including radiological supervision and interpretation
Insertion of catheter for imaging of heart blood vessels or grafts
Insertion or replacement of permanent pacemaker and upper chamber electrodes

Percutaneous transluminal revascularization of or through coronary artery bypass graft (internal mammary, free arterial, venous), any combination of drug-eluting intracoronary stent, atherectomy and angioplasty, including distal protection when performed;
Insertion of needle and/or catheter into dialysis circuit, with imaging including radiological supervision and interpretation
Insertion of heart rhythm monitor under skin
Removal of central venous catheter for infusion
Insertion of catheter in left heart for imaging of blood vessels or grafts and left lower heart
Balloon dilation of narrowed or blocked major coronary artery or branch (accessed through the skin)

Vessel mapping of vessels for hemodialysis access (services for preoperative vessel mapping prior to creation of hemodialysis access using an autogenous hemodialysis conduit, including arterial inflow and venous outflow)
Ultrasound scan of blood flow in extremity on both sides of body for preoperative assessment of blood vessel for dialysis access
